meanings.definition: An attempt to prevent people from discovering the truth about a serious mistake or crime.
meanings.sent1: The coverup of the stolen cookies was quickly revealed by the trail of crumbs.
meanings.sent2: The detective uncovered the coverup of the robbery through careful investigation.
meanings.sent3: The coverup of the missing homework was so obvious that even the dog looked guilty.
meanings.sent4: The coverup of the secret party was like trying to hide an elephant in a teacup.
meanings.sent5: The coverup of the broken vase was so poorly done that it only drew more attention to the accident.

meanings.definition: Something that is used to hide or protect something else.
meanings.sent1: She used a towel as a coverup from the sun at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The tarp served as a coverup for the old furniture during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The coverup of the leaky faucet with a plant was a creative solution.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog acted as a natural coverup for the approaching ship.
meanings.sent5: The makeup artist applied a coverup to hide the actor's tattoo for the scene.

meanings.sent1: She tried to coverup the mistake by quickly changing the subject.
meanings.sent2: The cat attempted to coverup its tracks by walking in circles.
meanings.sent3: He tried to coverup the burnt toast by drenching it in jam.
meanings.sent4: The politician's attempt to coverup the scandal only made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The magician used sleight of hand to coverup the disappearance of the coin.
